Package demolition

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Movable
    Interface that is implemented by all movingobjects which could move in specific cardinal directions
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Animation
    Holds and plays the image objects that makes up the animation for the sprite on screen
    App
    Runs the game
    Bomb
    Bomb object that can be placed by the player, and which spawns an explosion that destroys walls
    BrokenWall
    A wall that can be broken wall by bombs
    Empty
    Empty background tile that players and enemies stand on
    Enemy
    Abstract enemy object that depends on movement strategies concretely implemented by EnemyYellow and EnemyRed
    EnemyRed
    Concrete implementation of enemy that moves in a random direction upon hitting a wall
    EnemyYellow
    Concrete implementation of enemy that moves in clockwise upon hitting a wall
    Explosion
    Spawns a set of explosiontiles from the location that the bomb was placed, and ensures explosions only break 1 breakable wall max and do not penetrate solidwalls
    ExplosionTile
    Explosion tile, can be centre, vertical, or horizontal, and destroys any moving thing and brokenwall in its path.
    GameManager
    Manages the game state and aftermath of explosions (eliminating the player and destroying walls), and the levelling system so that the player goes to the next level (or wins if it is the last level) once they collide with the goal tile (provided they don't hit an explosion or enemy first)
    GameObject
    Central GameObject template class that all tiles and moving objects inherit from
    Goal
    Goal tile that moves the player to the next level if they step on it
    Level
    The Level object holds the time limit for the level, and all objects in the level, and can reset all objects to their starting position/status and return objects in the level
    Loader
    Loads in the level(s) as level objects based on config files provided
    MovingObject
    Template class GameObjects which require directional based animations and knowledge of the current level
    Player
    The bomberman that is controlled by the player through keyboard input in the app class
    SolidWall
    Wall tile that cannot be broken by bombs and cannot be stepped through
    SpriteFactory
    Class that helps construct images for the constructors of GameObjects to help construct objects in one line without having to load in images repeatedly
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Direction
    Directional enum that helps keep track the direction an animation is played for and the direction that enemies and players are currently facing
